message.content:
<command-message>pull_request</command-message>
<command-name>/pull_request</command-name>
<command-args>feature-5-4083bb3a-add-new-task {"number":5,"title":"Add new task","body":"/feature\n\nAdd a button to \"Add new task\". A task can have a date, a title, a description and a type (personal, work, other). All mandatory. When a user clicks this button we will show a modal with a form to fill in this information. After submission we will use the server enpoint to add the task. We also need to read the week tasks, and if there is a task in the week, we will show it as a card in the date box.","state":"OPEN","author":{"id":"MDQ6VXNlcjYzNzk5MTg0","login":"juan-calou","name":"Juan Calou","is_bot":false},"assignees":[],"labels":[],"milestone":null,"comments":[],"createdAt":"2026-01-21T14:08:08Z","updatedAt":"2026-01-21T14:08:08Z","closedAt":null,"url":"https://github.com/juan-calou/tac-week-planner/issues/5"} specs/feature-5-add-new-task.md 4083bb3a</command-args>

content.text:
# Create Pull Request

Based on the `Instructions` below, take the `Variables` follow the `Run` section to create a pull request. Then follow the `Report` section to report the results of your work.

## Variables

branch_name: $1
issue: $2
plan_file: $3
adw_id: $4

## Instructions

- Generate a pull request title in the format: `<issue_type>: #<issue_number> - <issue_title>`
- The PR body should include:
  - A summary section with the issue context
  - Link to the implementation plan file
  - Reference to the issue (Closes #<issue_number>)
  - ADW tracking ID
  - A checklist of what was done
  - A summary of key changes made
- Extract issue number, type, and title from the issue JSON
- Examples of PR titles:
  - `feat: #123 - Add user authentication`
  - `bug: #456 - Fix login validation error`
  - `chore: #789 - Update dependencies`

## Run

1. Run `git diff origin/main...HEAD --stat` to see a summary of changed files
2. Run `git log origin/main..HEAD --oneline` to see the commits that will be included
3. Run `git diff origin/main...HEAD --name-only` to get a list of changed files
4. Run `git push -u origin <branch_name>` to push the branch
5. Set GH_TOKEN environment variable from GITHUB_PAT if available, then run `gh pr create --title "<pr_title>" --body "<pr_body>" --base main` to create the PR
6. Capture the PR URL from the output

## Report

Return ONLY the PR URL that was created (no other text)

ARGUMENTS: feature-5-4083bb3a-add-new-task {"number":5,"title":"Add new task","body":"/feature\n\nAdd a button to \"Add new task\". A task can have a date, a title, a description and a type (personal, work, other). All mandatory. When a user clicks this button we will show a modal with a form to fill in this information. After submission we will use the server enpoint to add the task. We also need to read the week tasks, and if there is a task in the week, we will show it as a card in the date box.","state":"OPEN","author":{"id":"MDQ6VXNlcjYzNzk5MTg0","login":"juan-calou","name":"Juan Calou","is_bot":false},"assignees":[],"labels":[],"milestone":null,"comments":[],"createdAt":"2026-01-21T14:08:08Z","updatedAt":"2026-01-21T14:08:08Z","closedAt":null,"url":"https://github.com/juan-calou/tac-week-planner/issues/5"} specs/feature-5-add-new-task.md 4083bb3a
I'll create a pull request for this feature branch.

input.command:
export GH_TOKEN="${GITHUB_PAT}" && gh pr create --title "feat: #5 - Add new task" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

This PR implements task creation functionality with a modal form interface, as specified in issue #5.

## Implementation Plan

See: [specs/feature-5-add-new-task.md](specs/feature-5-add-new-task.md)

## Closes

Closes #5

## ADW Tracking ID

4083bb3a

## What Was Done

- [x] Added Task model with required fields (date, title, description, type)
- [x] Implemented modal form UI with validation for all mandatory fields
- [x] Added task type selection (personal, work, other) with color coding
- [x] Integrated with server endpoint to create tasks
- [x] Implemented task retrieval and display in week view
- [x] Enhanced UI to show tasks as cards within date boxes
- [x] Added comprehensive tests for task creation API

## Key Changes

- **Frontend**: 
  - `app/client/src/app/app.component.ts`: Added modal logic, form handling, and task display
  - `app/client/src/app/app.component.html`: Added modal UI and task card rendering
  - `app/client/src/app/app.component.css`: Styled modal and task cards with type-based colors
  - `app/client/src/app/models/task.model.ts`: Added task type field
  - `app/client/src/app/services/task.service.ts`: Added getTasksByWeek method
  
- **Backend**:
  - `app/server/models.py`: Added task_type field to Task model
  - `app/server/database.py`: Updated database schema
  - `app/server/crud.py`: Enhanced task creation and retrieval logic
  - `app/server/tests/test_api.py`: Added comprehensive test coverage
EOF
)" --base main
